Posted By: bark_at_the_moonn (11/16/2008 11:27:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm afraid alot of you are wrong about what would happen if you were to stifle a Phyrexian Dreadnought. The official text on the card says, "When Phyrexian Dreadnought enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice any number of creatures with total power 12 or greater." If you were to stifle that, it would stop everything after the word "When" thus making it so you wouldn't have to sacrifice anything. The definition of a triggered ability is anything that follows the words "When", "Whenever", or "At".
posts.html:
I'm afraid alot of you are wrong about what would happen if you were to stifle a Phyrexian Dreadnought. The official text on the card says, "When Phyrexian Dreadnought enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice any number of creatures with total power 12 or greater." If you were to stifle that, it would stop everything after the word "When" thus making it so you wouldn't have to sacrifice anything. The definition of a triggered ability is anything that follows the words "When", "Whenever", or "At".

Posted By: insanepainbringer (8/27/2009 1:25:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yeah right... If Stifle countering "When this creature enters the battlefield..." causes this creature not to enter then Stifle countering "At the end of turn..." causes the turn not to end.  
  
"When" and "At" are CONDITIONS for triggered abilities - just like "Pay life" or "tap" are COSTS for activated abilites. You dont counter them.
posts.html:
Yeah right... If Stifle countering "When this creature enters the battlefield..." causes this creature not to enter then Stifle countering "At the end of turn..." causes the turn not to end.
